reviewText: Wow...wow.  That's really all to say.  It's great that "Jem" is finally seeing a fantastic celebration of her legend immoratlized in digital fabulousness, but my "Wow...wow" comes from the effort that Rhino put into this beauty.  The DVD set is beautifully packaged; from the glittery logo cover to the included bonus tidbits.  The packaging itself is filled with pictures of Jem and her rock star sisters (although Pizzazz has brown hair in one insert; that was before she went punk) and has this fabulous pink envelope kinda thing holding all 4 disc snuggly in place.  Amazingly, Rhino has included some prety cool features in this set; including a (limited) commentary track, interviews, Jem "videos", and even an interview with "Jem" herself.  The audio and video quality is quite good, far surpassing the quality of the recently issued JEM VHS tapes.  Granted "Jem" doesn't have the hugely loud fan base (read He-Man) as other 80's relics, this is an amazing tribute to an 80's essential.  Today's modern little girl may not quite get this one, but this DVD set isn't for her anyway.

reviewText: Love the 80's?Grow up watching the show?Just curious?All of the above are excellent reasons to go and buy this 4 DVD set of the first two seasons of Jem!  If you're like me and grew up watching this show as a child or a newcomer just curious about all the hype I promise you, you will not be disappointed with this DVD.Included in this set are the first 26 of the shows 65 episode run.  Starting with the beginning/origins of Jem and the Holograms and going right up to Glitter and Gold.  You get to see all of the original songs in their glory (I think there's actually an option to play just the songs!!!!) plus massive 80's fashion at its best!  There's also all of the original PSA that were featured at the end of shows, plus an interview with Christie Marx, the shows creator, which I found to be incredibly informative.  She explains the motivating factors behind the different characters, who some of the characters were based upon, and some of the things she would liked to have done differently.  I honestly never realized how many of the decisions that were made for the show were based upon the product marketing for the doll line by Hasbro.  There's also an interview with the speaking voice for Jem (the girls name unfortunately slips my mind at the moment something Newark I think...).So honestly, if you were even slightly considering getting this DVD go ahead and get it, it's as good as I remember as a child, even better.  Hopefully Rhino will realize the success of this and how long fans of Jem have waited and will not dilly dally on releasing Seasons 3 and 4 of this "Truly Outrageous!" show!!!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Let me start off by saying that I am only 15 years old, and a guy. So I didn't grow up watching Jem, I wasn't an 80's child, and I've never seen it before the DVD came out.Well I saw this Jem DVD at the store, I never heard of the show, but I thought the cover looked kinda interesting, and read the back of the box and thought that the summary of the show sounded pretty interested. I didn't get it though. When I came home I went on the internet to look up a little more about the show. After I saw all the great reviews, went to a few fan sites, and heard some of the songs, I thought I just had to get my hands on this thing, so I bought it, and I really started to like it.Although it's easy to tell by watching it that this series was made years ago, the animation is done very well for something made in the 80's. And the story lines are done pretty well. And the other reviewers are right; this is pretty heated for a cartoon. Now, notice I said FOR A CARTOON. Don't be expecting anything too raunchy on this show. But they do have a lot of kissing on the lips and a few slapping people here and there.The music is also very good. The Holograms songs are more poppy kinda stuff. While the Misfits are more kinda Avril Lavinge kinda thing.I don't really think that this show is only for girls. Although the main characters are female, there is plenty of action for us guys, and Christy Marx, the creator of the show explains that although the show was meant for girls, she made it to where boys would be interested in it too. Apparently, it worked!The extras in this box set are pretty good too. They have an interview with Samantha Newark, the voice of Jem. She talks a little more about her singing career than about Jem, but it's still informative. The interview with Christy Marx, the creator and writer of show, is twice as long as Samantha Newark's, and EXTREMELY informative, she talks about her growing up, how she got into the business, how the Jem show started, what it was like working on it, the music, how she had to keep both genders interested, and a lot more.Oh, and in both interviews, both of them say that they want Jem to come back, so let's hope that happens.The discs all have the same design, which is the logo of the show, except each disc is a different color.The interior artwork is really bad. I don't think it looks like a 6 year old drew it, but it sure doesn't look like a professional did. I really don't know why people think the cover is so bad, I think it's okay, but whatever.Well I really recommend this show to any gender or any age, because this really is a good cartoon.
summary: Jem and the Holograms- The Complete First & Second Seasons

reviewText: When I first saw this on the store shelf in Circuit City I nearly DIED! Jem, was one of my FAVORITE Saturday morning cartoons of the 80's. Although it was $65.00 I bought THREE copies of this. I planned to save one as a collectable, and view the other sets at my leisure. If a disc were to get ruined, I'd have a backup. This has not occurred and I still have 2 sets sealed. Rhino, the parent company that owned Jem (and My Little Pony), fell on hard times. They released these cartoons for much needed capital. It was not to be however and Rhino folded after the release of season 3 part1 of the Jem collection and before the rest of My Little Pony could be released.The dvd's are awesome. The quality excellent and the menu is easy to navigate through. A definite must have for every Jem fan out there. I'm happy I bought 3 sets of this DVD and season 3 part 1. I just may sell a copy if ever I need extra cash myself ; ).Great memories. Hours of 80's viewing nostalgia.

reviewText: I am so excited about this, I could burst! JEM was THE greatest cartoon when I was a kid. Such a hip show and the camp factor could not be denied. I love how Jem & the Holograms gave 30 second concerts! The music was superb (though the repeating of the chorus over & over was laughable). As much as I love Jem, the Misfits were the more appealing characters. They were such tragically flawed characters. Pizzazz as the little girl who was always searching for her father's love. Roxy, who we later learn is illiterate. Stormer, torn between her inadequecies and loyalty to her band. Jetta, ashamed of how she grew up and wanting more. So sit back and enjoy some fun music and action, though it is puzzling that since Jem's life was always in danger during each commercial break...why didn't she just call the cops?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Jem was truly outrageous!  She started off as a line of dolls by Hasbro, and one poor writer had to come up with a storyline just from snapshots of the toys.  But give it to the woman for grace under pressure because what we got was a girl centered show that had action, adventure, and ... well ... music videos!  Jem emerged to be a more popular show than even the dolls because boys clicked to the hip fact that the animation of the women was pretty easy to look at and the show moved quickly from one state of peril to the next.Rhino delivers a great set of DVDs.  The colors are candy coated, and you can select how you want to hear the episodes. You also get commentary on the first episode, and a montage of ALL the music videos.  Great job!  A fan's dream!Now something else has been nagging me... Did anyone else kind of like the MISFITS songs just a little better than the sugary sweet stylings of the HOLOGRAMS?  They were no nonsense straight up divas!  Spoiled and rotten, but they had better guitar lines and really tight harmonies.  They were like a cartoon/pop version of HOLE.  Hmmmm!And why did Rio (Jem's boyfriend) have purple hair?  And boy was he fickle about Jem/Jericha and who he preferred.  And how did that hologram hold up when they were kissing?  Synergy was pretty dang good!Enjoy JEM!  The 80s only cartoon pop diva!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Few would claim that Jem was the best show ever, but it is a lot of fun.  How many shows are as much about muisc, fashion and dance as high speed chases, cuttnig edge technology and social consciousness?  That all these disperate elements came together in an even mildly successful show would be a wonder but Jem was not only successful but a phenomonon that has survived the years.Kids today might laugh at the awful animation, corny dialogue and fashions, but the underlying themes and fun are undeniable.  I'm sure most who buy this set though will be doing so for nostalgia.  Well luckliy, that's here in spades.  All the PSAs created for the show are included (some I didn't even remember seeing) and browsing through the production bible will reveal insights to character and franchise motivations.  But the best feature of this set (aside from having the shows on DVD at all) is the ability to watch only the musical segments.  The music was the main reason I liked Jem in the first place and I'm sure mor eoften than not I'll only be watching teh musical segments anyway.  This feature is just perfect!I'm eagerly awaiting further season sets of Jem and Truly Outrageous trips down memory lane.

reviewText: Hola amigos;What a great surprise to learn that my favorite cartoon gal Jem is available in DVD!. I was a kid back to 1987 when they first aired "Jem and the Holograms" here in Lima-Peru (South America) and I like it from the very begining! Here in Peru the merchandise wasn't as heavy as in USA as a matter of fact it was inexistance so I used to tape the songs that I like straight from the original TV broadcasting to my tape recorder by using the audio cables for left and right input from my TV set.For this DVD edition I wish they would have add the spanish audio track, anyway I seriouly am thinking on owning the "Jem" DVD.I remember quite well that there seem to be two animation teams (maybe more) that produced the episodes as in some of them there are high quality animation, even the pretty faces with all their "glam" make up were really nicely done while the other team seem to draw it too fast and there seem to be some flaws in their movements and aparience.Besides all the fantasy that you expect in a cartoon something I liked about Jem was that the characters were not as two dimensions as they seem to be as they explored each one of their inner feelings and wishes in many episodes.Jem was not only a silly group of girls fighting with super powers against the Misfits or whatever any other danger might be nor they were solving misteries here and there like the silly cartoons from the 70's.If they would have been made nowadays they would have got that japanese animation influence look and post-Matrix performing impossible stunts and flips ala "Charlie Angels".Fortunatelly Jem belongs to the 80's heaven back with my happy memories of my childhood.Something that might be funny for you was that the TV station that broadcasted "Jem" nation wide here in Peru (Canal 2 Frecuencia Latina) accidentaly used to place the audio switch sometimes in the sound track mode so there was no dialogue at all but incedental music and special sound effects! Just like a special bonus feature DVD!This little mistake did last once almost an entire episode!It's going to be nice to watch Jem again after almost 10 years I hadn't seen it again.Oh, I just remember their new opening theme for the last season! ha,ha,ha,ha!Let me know if you ever come to visit Peru and the impressive Machu Picchu ruins I work for the Tourist Information Office here in Lima-Peru and would love to help you out in whatever you might need......just like a hologram from Cynergy but real!Looking forward to hear back from you all very soon.Cesar DominguezA Peruvian Young Man of HonorLima-PeruHomepage: [...] (with some pics of Machu Picchu and much more)
summary: Jem and the 80's cartoons from Lima-Peru

reviewText: I used to watch this show when I was a little girl, and I'm so happy that I got this dvd.  Now I'm 21, and Jem is still the coolest!!!  Also, the dvd is for an awesome price...I have been watching Jem all evening!!!  However, I never realized how wild the show is!!  I guess I was too little to understand...Eric even backslapped Jerrica!!!  I almost fell out of my chair!!  There are a few glitches on the dvd, but to me they were more humorous than upsetting.  I mean, come on, it's from the 80s, and we all know there were all sorts of crazy mistakes in cartoons if you look close enough.  Anyway, I think every 80s child (or girl at least) needs to own this.  It's definitely an important part of our childhoods.  That's all I have to say, now I have to watch Jem defeat the Misfits (who, on a side note, are some really crazy and spoiled broads)!!!

reviewText: Words can not express my pleasure with the four disc DVD review of the now first and second season of Jem.  The DVD comes in a big package that opens like a book.  Inside each of the discs is encased in a shell that is behind a characters images-Jem, Shana, Kimber and Aja.  The backside of the opening case that protests the discs includes a picture of The Misfits. Enclosed with the set is a booklet-hot pink of course as is the rest of the casing is Jem's signature hot pink and yello color.  The booklet has descriptions of all of the episodes and extras.One thing that baffles me, a lifelong Jem fan is that on the back of the DVD Jem's hologram sidekick Synergy's name is spelled Cynergi.  It is spelled like that in the booklet mostly except for one or two entries where it is spelled Synergi.  Oh yeah, the backside of The Misfits image is a picture of Jem & Rio kissing.It is great that we finally have Jem on DVD.  The episode quality is awesome.  I just got mine in the mail today from AMAZON and have not yet seen all 26 episodes but the ones I watched were of excellent sound and picture quality.  The extras are awesome. Oh yeah, fans remember how on some of the episodes one character would be speaking but another characters voice would come out, I don't know if this was fixed or if the episodes were left in their original state, but it is great seeing Jem on DVD for the very first time.As mentioned in other reviews, there is a "watch videos" extra that will allow you to watch all of the Jem/Misfit music videos.  The disc 4 contains all of the extras which include and interview by Samantha Newark the speaking voice of Jem and commentary by writer Christy Marx.  Another AWESOME extra is notes from the Jem production bible.  This gives fans a unique insight into the production of the show.  One instance describes how song writers should give a synposis of the songs theme vs writing the song.  It's filled with a neat little glimpse into the production of the show.Also included are those wonderful Jem public service announcements, "Doing The Write Thing Makes You A Superstar!".Of course this is just the first 26 episodes, which means no Jetta, Raya, Regine, Astral or The Stingers, but hopefully this first release will be a super smash and Rhino will release all remaining episodes in the very near future.You will not be disapointed in this release.

reviewText: I have a new found respect for Rhino Home Video. In their infinite wisdom, they know what the people want! We want our '80s cartoons! After starting on GI Joe and Transformers, Rhino has FINALLY started releasing Jem!! I would like to personally say thank you to them! This cartoon is so much fun....it's an instant classic. The most interesting thing about this show is how it totally berates men. Rio is made out to be a dumb sod who can't figure out that Jem is really Jerrica in disguise. You would think they would kiss the same, right??!?!? I mean, they do it in EVERY EPISODE! Then, there is Eric Raymond! He's evil to the core....LOL...but oh sooo loveable! Now, on to my personal favorites, Zipper and Techrat! Zipper....the thug wannabe and Techrat...the nerdy guy with high-tech devices he can't use! Oh, of course, then there are Kimber's multiple boyfriends, and movie stars who croon after Jem to no avail.....Of course, we all know the MISFITS were the better band! Come on, the Misfits' songs were so good....compared to Jem's sap. Granted, she had a couple of good ones...like Glitter 'n Gold...but like most of the other reviewers...the Misfits are pretty awesome.The sound and picture quality of the show is really nice on DVD. It's just like watching it for the first time. The commentaries are very interesting too. It's neat to learn how a show develops over time.My recommendation: Go out and get this right away! The price may be a little steep, but hey, where else can you see real plots in a great cartoon classic!?

reviewText: Jem has always been my all-time favourite cartoon series.Powerpuff girls and Kim Possible can't even hold a candle next to the outrageous Jem and the Holograms!This DVD set has everthing you could ever ask for! Wooohooo!The Jem episodes from this DVD which I highly recommend are:~Starbright - 1 - Falling Star~Starbright - 2 - Colliding Star~ Starbright - 3 - Rising Star~In Search of the Stolen Album~Glitter 'N Gold~Hot Time in Hawaii

reviewText: Having established the TRULY OUTRAGEOUS! JEM Mailing List on the internet, and being part of the letter-writing campaign to get Jem released on DVD, I was so stoked to be able to purchase this DVD set when it first came out.This set contains the first twenty-six episodes of the series.  The first disc has seven episodes, the second disc has seven episodes, the third disc has seven episodes, and the fourth disc has five episodes.The first disc contains commentary on the first episode ("The Beginning") by Christy Marx, the woman who developed the Jem animated series.  There is also a "Play Songs" feature, which allows you to view the "music videos" from the episodes as stand-alone pieces.  The second disc contains a commentary on episode thirteen ("The Music Awards Part 1") by Christy Marx, as well as the "Play Songs" feature.The third disc only includes the "Play Songs" feature.  The fourth disc contains the most bonus features on the set.  There is commentary on episode twenty-three ("The Jem Jam Part 1") and on episode twenty-six ("Glitter and Gold") by Christy Marx, there is the "Play Songs" feature, an interview with Christy Marx, an interview with Samantha Newark (the voice actor whio provided the speaking voice for Jerrica and Jem), the public service announcements that originally aired with some of the episodes included on the set, and excerpts from the Jem production bible (the bible was written by Christy with character descriptions and series guidelines, which the writers on the shows referred to when writing their episodes for the series).Overall, I was rather pleased with the final product that was released.  Unfortunately, this set is now out of print, so it may be hard to track down.  However, if you're a Jem fan who is fortunate enough to come across a used copy of this DVD set, I would recommend picking it up.I wrote this review after watching the copy of this DVD set that my husband and I purchased.
summary: The first DVD set released for the 1980's cartoon Jem

reviewText: I was so excited to find out that this favorite show of my childhood was coming on DVD, and preordered it right away.  Watching it now I can still see why I liked it so much when I was little-such a fun show!  The stories are very engaging, often ending with a gripping cliffhanger.  Kind of a soap opera for kids!  (Only this one's actually good!)  Most of the songs are great and a lot of fun-it's amazing they were able to churn out so many new songs every week.  Plus, what girl of any age can resist all the fashion and glamour of Jem?  The corniness of the villains and their harebrained schemes will make you giggle but you'll be entertained through and through.One thing I really like about Jem is that, as the lead heroine, she is not just a total helpless innocent priss à la Snow White.  Aside from being kind she's also determined, strong, intelligent, brave, independent and street-smart.  She's also not perfect-e.g. she has no patience for the immature antics of the Misfits.  The Misfits are sort of cool as well.  You'll probably cheer on the Holograms' side but the Misfits have their way of bringing out the bad girl in you.  Both groups are cool in their own way (good-girl sirens/naughty minxes)-and all that colorful, outrageous hair is the icing on the cake!The DVD comes in really cool packaging and the extras are solid.  The commentaries (4 total) and interviews (one by creator Christy Marx and one by Samantha Newark, the voice of Jem) are interesting, and the Jem PSAs are cute although corny.  There's also a "Jem Production Bible" which is very long (50 pages) but contains a lot of interesting info.  You can also go straight to the songs on each disc with the "Play Songs" feature.I hope they release the rest of the series soon; if and when they do I'll be certain to snatch that up right away!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I don't think I need to tell Jem fans why they should get this so this is for those of you that don't know what Jem is about. Here's a synopsis from the dvd cover: After her father passes away, Jerrica Benton inherits half of his company, Starlight Music. The other half has been given to the ruthless Eric Raymond. Raymond plans to exploit Starlight to promote a new band called the Misfits. Jerrica doesn't believe that this was her father's plan, but she is powerless to do anything about it. That is until a remarkable computer companion named Synergy enters her life (thanks also to her father). With a huge supply of instruments left by her father and using Synergy's impressive holographic powers, Jerrica, her younger sister Kimber, and their friends are transformed into the rock band, "Jem and the Holograms." Now, as the lead singer, Jem, Jerrica sets out to make the Holograms dreams a reality, and at the same time keep a group of young girls, a boyfriend Rio, and the record company happy. --This show was truly underrated. Thankfully a bunch of fans like myself kept an interest enough to get these classic cartoons out on dvd! I enjoyed this as a kid and I still love watching it today as an adult! Introduce your kids to this show because unlike many cartoons today, there aren't many that actually are entertaining with action and drama but also promote strong moral values. Throughout the series there are quality episodes that talk about sensitive topics like runaways, stealing, drugs, suicide, etc...but its also done in a manner that a child can understand and theres ALWAYS an emphasis on talking with a loved one if you ever have a problem. And when the show isn't about a moral issue, there's the popular fun feud to enjoy between Jem and their jealous rivals, The Misfits! The Misfits are constantly causing trouble for Jem and The Holograms and as a result both groups often get themselves in quite a bit of trouble as they travel around the world. One other clever little sub-plot is the love triangle Jerrica formed between herself, Rio, and Jem! Because she's hiding her identity as Jem to Rio, she's only managed to become jealous of herself!There's also a few short original pop song segments thrown in that sound better than alot of 80s songs! Its just too bad they are only about a minute in length. To give you an example of what a great role model Jem can be to both boys and girls, here's a couple lines from the Jem and the Holograms song "How You Play The Game": 'it's how you play the game...how you play the game, that's where it begins, how you play the game (how you play the game), How are you're feeling at the finish, when its all over, that's what really matters, not who wins.' See! Sure, a little cheesy, but the kids could use positive messages like that. Anyways, buy this set! you can also check out the episode guide at [...]*** Update Oct.2005 - I disagree about it not being worth 100 bucks! It really depends on what the cartoon is worth to you but as a Jem fan, I would gladly pay 100 bucks to obtain this collection. There's also nothing wrong with those sellers getting 4 times what they paid for it. We all had the chance to buy an extra copy when they were at an affordable cost. Unfortunately it went out of print and therefore is now a collector's item. The value goes up.
summary: Best cartoon in tv animation history!

reviewText: I'm an 18 male and love this show. I love most every show from the '80s: Care Bears, Rainbow Bright, Strawberry Shortcake, "Them Glowing Worms", GI JOE, Turtles, this one about talking koalas, etc... And Jem is number 1!The story is so moving and involving. I remember sitting down a night after I got it and planning to just watch one episode. But it ended with a total cliff hanger and I just had to watch the second. I just finished the first disc and am scared to start on the second... It's such a good show I don't want it to be over!The music is great too. I love it! I downloaded all the songs from the entire show on a Jem fansite. I'm disappointed to find out there has never been an album released of their music with full length songs. I'm listening to a CD of the Misfits right! =DI am going to die if they don't release the rest of the episodes.The show is appealing to not only children but older people too as the story deals with relationships and love. Today cartoon shows are disgusting, other then anime imported from Japan. Only anime is missing something. Anime is usually too serious or too bizarre, never just right as is Jem.I pray they relase the rest of Jem and more 80 cartoons. And I used to hope they would re-create these shows. However, after seeing the new Strawberry Shortcake and Turtles, I pray that they don't. After the rest of JEm is released, I wanna see the Little Ponys./sigh... I'm already dreading the day I finish this box set. I'm really try to drag it out. But the end of Jem is enevitable seeing there is only 65 episodes. How many episodes of GI JOE and TRansformers are there? I got both those box sets too and they're just terrible. Absolutely boring, absurd and unrealastic.

reviewText: Being a child of the 80's there are many things that I love and adore growing, one of them was JEM.  I know it may sound weird, because i'm a guy and the show was taylored to appeal to girls, but I'm sure there were some guys out there that loved the show simply because of the gorgeous babes on display.This show epitomized all that was great about the 80's, the big hair, the glitz, the glamour, the music, it was outrageous.  the show may have been a cartoon, but there was a great deal of depth to this show than most cartoons because of its intelligence and sophistication while still showing itself to be acceptable to kids, pre-teens, etc.The show possesses an infectious charm, something that even as an adult grabs a hold of your heart and appeals to the child inside in a way that is simply marvelous.There are some important lessons to be learned here, things that are easy to catch onto without being overtly trite and obvious, and these are lessons that make sense and do not insult the intelligence of the viewers.  Plus, the battle of the bands between The Holograms and The Misfits for dominance over the music charts truly symbolizes the sort of cutthroat ambitious mentality the music industry can sometimes be.  It is also something that can be truly inspirational to anyone, working hard, sticking by your friends, and believing in yourself, anything is possible.I am so glad that this show is being released on DVD, because the show can now be enjoyed by the original fans who grew up with it and be introduced to a whole new generation.
summary: Jem is excitement, Jem is adventure!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I watched this cartoon faithfully as a little girl and even had some of the (admittedly) cloying toys. I also thought I was cool pretending to change idenities with my own red star earings. The music is very different from my own current preferences, but I continue to remember some of the songs.Jerrica Benton is a do-gooder millonare who runs the Starlight Foundation for Girls, but she also masquerades as the hologram- created JEM, lead singer for the Holograms. Few people have an idea of who she really is, including her (admittedly hot) boyfriend Rio.Their chief rivals are the Misfits (who actually rock) and Starlight Music's executive Eric Raymond. Technically Jerrica should also have full control of Starlight Music's roster and quality control. But I must have missed the explaination because the Holograms are structurally on the outs with regards to industry resources.Synergy is housed in what appears to be an abandoned drive-in theater, even though a private investigator (hired by Eric Raymond, duh!) manages to sneak in, take photos, and temporarily damage Synergy during one episode. She then is moved to Starlight Mansion (where Jerrica and the girls live!) but  something this important to the band's success and other people's survival should have been properly secured from the begining.The best character is Stormer, the only Misfit with a heart of gold. She likes the musical arrangements of her group, but despises the way Pizzaz (the Misfit leader) and Roxy treat other people. Stormer would leave, but Pizzaz and Roxy have erroneously convinced her that she is not any good and would never be able to make it outside the group.The only really anyoying people in the series are Kimberly Benton, Jerrica's younger sister/bandmate who periodically broods about being the younger sister, and Ashley, a "Starlight girl" who wants to emmulate some of the Misfit's more destructive habits (although she was drawn so cool because she always resembled a cheetah and the other girls looked so square even to me back then!).Personally given a choice, I prefer 80's cartoons over the stuff now being peddled on the broadcast and cable networks. I hope the release of this DVD encourages the production of other long-loved series from the era.
summary: I can't believe this reached DVD
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's easy to see why everyone loves this cartoon. I believe I speak for everyone when I say why the hell was this show canceled? This show was addictive, if not for the weirdly enchanting music video segments, for the colorful and intriguing storylines. The show had a really LONG way to go had it not been canceled. I especially loved the way the characters were portrayed as if they were real people.
summary: Another victim of that loathsome demon called: Cancellation
Title: N/A

reviewText: I got this DVD set for my 20th birthday and been watching it since :) I LOVE IT!  I've always been a fan of Jem and I'm so glad that Rhino decided to release all the Jem episodes on DVD.  I'm looking forward to sharing this cartoon with my niece and children (when I have some in the future).This DVD is a best buy because you not only get wonderful episodes, but you get the movie, which is titled "The Beginning", and it's perfect for if you or any kids you know just started watching Jem and see how it all began.Some worthy episodes besides "The Beginning" include Starbright parts 1, 2, and 3, The World Hunger Shindig, In Stitches, Hot Time In Hawaii, The Princess and the Singer, Them Jem Jam parts 1 & 2, and Culture Clash.I didn't start watching Jem until I was about 8 years old when it'd be reruns on USA with my cousin. I loved it ever since, especially the music by both the Holograms and the misfits! The DVD menu is wonderful, and the bonus features are great, including how they let you play just the songs that were featured in each episode.So all in all, this DVD is worth it and everyone of all ages will enjoy this cartoon! Let's hope that more comapnies will release other great 80's cartoons on DVD as well :)

reviewText: I have to thank Rhino for FINALLY putting this DVD out.  I knew I bought a DVD player for a reason.  I'd like to request that someone put out the cartoon "Wait Till Your Father Gets Home" on DVD also.  That cartoon was a great one also.  I found out about it by watching Cartoon Network.  It came out in the early 70's.  It's quite shocking to see the things that go on with the Boyle family. I'd also love to see "Smurfs" on DVD too.Now back to Jem I love everything about Jem.  There are no cartoons out now that compare to Jem.  I'm glad I still have my VHS episodes though because I'm leary when I read about the problems with certain eposides on the DVD.  I hope Rhino fixes the problem.  We Jem fans are die hard and we deserve the best.  Thanks again!

reviewText: This cartoon has had a major impact and influence on my taste in music as an adult. Therefore, I just had to review and just talk about it. It's amazing how what you see as a kid can influence your adult hood.The best part of "JEM" is/was "The Misfits", They're the ones that made this cartoon worth wild. If it wasn't for the attitude n Wickednezz of "Pizzazz" (Leader of The Misfits) I most likely would not have tuned in then, or purchased this boxset today.Although "The Misfits" plan was to have JEM's music career destroyed I always could hardly wait for Pizzazz and The girls a.k.a. "The Showstoppers" to do their stuff and cause a big mess.The only problem I have with this cartoon is the animation at times, It couldv'e been better. Yes it was made in the 80's but I can remember cartoons that were animated long before JEM that had much better animation. Snow White is the first Disney animation created in 1939 and it looks better than this. Yet and still I'm all for it.My two favorite "Music Video/Scenes" are "Only The Beginning" By JEM & The Holograms and "Universal Appeal" and "Designing Women" which are both performed by the true DIVAZ "The Misfits", I loved their songs so much I converted them all to MP3's. YES! I did!!!!And not only do you get the complete 1st n 2nd Seasons of JEM but you also get to meet the creator of this fabulous series and the ladies who did the voices of the characters.The chick who did JEM's singing voice was annoying, JEM's singing was too much for me ,phew! She needed some vocal training or something.Anyways, This boxset is "Truly Outrageous" and I'm gonna get season's 3 and 4 Boxset which was not available when I purchased this back in 2003.
summary: The cartoon that influenced my taste in music, WOW!
